showScoreExcerpt:
Aside from Byrne’s experience of sexual molestation, there’s nothing very eye-opening here, and he doesn’t delve into marital...or political waters. Given the more or less familiar nature of his material, Byrne’s ability to hold our attention for this overlong exercise is a tribute to both his personal charisma and his artistic sensitivity. I can think of far worse things than listening for over two hours to Gabriel Byrne rattling on about the ghosts he walks with, even if I now and then am forced to stifle a yawn.
